text: HE OLY AMILY OF JESUS ARY AND JOSEPH ECEMBER 26 2021 Merry Christmas Welcome to all those joining us this weekend December 24th 26th as the Church celebrates both the Nativity of our Lord Jesus Christ December 24th 25th and the Feast of the Holy Family December 26th May the Lord fill your hearts with the joy of His peace and love as we continue to celebrate the birth of the Christchild And truly this celebration does continue The joy of the Incarnation cannot be contained by a single day For this reason Christmas is not simply a day but a season Though the world may quickly move on towards the next holiday may we continue to celebrate these Twelve Days of Christmas with great festivity for this is a time of great rejoicing Salvation Himself has come into the world for you and for me As you leave Mass this weekend we invite you to take with you a wrapped present from the narthex This is a gift on behalf of the parish to each of you Each package includes the latest daily devotional from Matthew Kellys Dynamic Catholic and a book from Gus Lloyds Minute in the Church series This years daily devotion is The Wisdom of Fulton Sheen 365 Days of Inspiration Venerable Fulton Sheen was one of the most wellknown Catholic voices throughout the 20th Century hosting Life is Worth Living a popular radio and television series Born in Peoria IL Bishop Sheen was a priest of the Diocese of Peoria before becoming an auxiliary bishop of the Archdiocese of New York and eventually the Bishop of Rochester This devotional offers daily meditations to carry us throughout the coming year Gus Lloyd is the host of the radio show Seize the Day on the Catholic Channel His series Minute in the Church offers short explanations to a variety of questions about the Catholic Faith Minute in the Church is a fivepart series Each gift package contains one volume After you finish your volume we encourage you to exchange it with others from the parish so that you have a chance to read the whole fivepart series special Thank You to all those who worked so hard to ensure our Christmas Liturgies were beautiful Our Decorating Committee did superb work in preparing the Church for these holy days Our Knights of Columbus helped to prepare our parish campus to shine throughout the Christmas season Our Choir Childrens Choir and instrumentalists put in many hours of practice to ensure that our liturgies were filled with beautiful music Many other hands especially our parish staff ichelle Teresa and Nathan have been an invaluable help throughout the Advent season and in preparing for our Christmas celebrations And of course thank you for so faithfully joining us for these celebrations The beauty of our church our campus and our music ARY OTHER OF OD On Saturday January 1st the Church celebrates the Solemnity of the Blessed VirginMary Mother of God This ancient celebration is traced back to the 5th Century and the Council of Ephesus which recognized Mary as Theotokos or Godbearer As this celebration falls on Saturday though it is a holy day it is not a holy day of obligation this year Though not a holy day of obligation may we see it as a holy day of opportunity Join us for Mass for this celebration on Saturday January 1st at 8 AM Faithfully in Christ Fr David MASS INTENTIONS Saturday December 25 4:35pm Rosary 5:00pm Gonzalo Riveros Sunday December 26 The Holy Family of 21621 Sun January 2 Epiphany of the Lord Is 601 6 Eph 323a56 Mt 2112 Seeing my loved ones and decorating with them Watching Christmas movies with my family Seeing beautiful bright Christmas trees and celebrating our Lords birth Thats what Christmas means to me Audrey Mechling Grade 5 When I think of Christmas besides the presents I think of joy and happiness family time and most importantly Jesus Christs birth I think of Jesus life and everything he did for us because He loves us That reminds me to use Jesus as my role model always but especially during the holiday season and to be kind to and love everyone like Jesus does to us Over the years Christmas has meant something different to me but as I have gotten older I know the true meaning of Christmas Christmas is about the gift from God That gift is Jesus Christ Jesus was born to give us eternal life and to take away our sins I am very thankful for everything Jesus did for us and Christmas is a great time to reflect on how it started and everything that was to come Beth Geisel Grade 12 Have fun with friends and family Christs birth give presents and get presents lot of people dont like giving presents but trust me itll make that person feel loved and itll make you feel appreciated for being on earth Luke Miller Grade 3 When I think of Christmas I think of family time and holiday spirit People filled with joy and love Presents under the Christmas tree Kids playing with their presents and a Christmas tree set up and Jesus in a manger bed Annie Herr Grade 2 What Christmas Means to Me There is always a very excited feeling in the last few days before Christmas There is a lot of shopping and a lot of decorating for this time of the year and it can sometimes be hard to remember what Christmas is truly about Christmas is not about giving or getting It is not about the fat man in the red suit Its about the birth of Jesus Christ and how the savior came into the world very important part of Jesus birth is that he was born in a stable That showed that He came to save all people not only the rich but the poor as well Being born on earth showed that He was human but because He is God He was divine too Charlie Andrews Grade 8 Christmas to me means presents and being with my family Ethan Howell Grade 1 PARISH CALENDAR Sat December 25 Confession 4445 pm Mass 5:00pm Sun December 26 Mass 7:30am 10:00am Sun December 26 No
